speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE I. France. Before Angiers.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter AUSTRIA and forces, drums, etc. on one side:  on the other KING PHILIP and his power; LEWIS, ARTHUR, CONSTANCE and attendants

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Before Angiers well met, brave Austria.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Arthur, that great forerunner of thy blood,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Richard, that robb'd the lion of his heart

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And fought the holy wars in Palestine,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: By this brave duke came early to his grave:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And for amends to his posterity,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: At our importance hither is he come,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To spread his colours, boy, in thy behalf,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And to rebuke the usurpation

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Of thy unnatural uncle, English John:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Embrace him, love him, give him welcome hither.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: God shall forgive you Coeur-de-lion's death

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The rather that you give his offspring life,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Shadowing their right under your wings of war:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I give you welcome with a powerless hand,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: But with a heart full of unstained love:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Welcome before the gates of Angiers, duke.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: A noble boy! Who would not do thee right?

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Upon thy cheek lay I this zealous kiss,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: As seal to this indenture of my love,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: That to my home I will no more return,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Till Angiers and the right thou hast in France,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Together with that pale, that white-faced shore,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Whose foot spurns back the ocean's roaring tides

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: And coops from other lands her islanders,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Even till that England, hedged in with the main,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: That water-walled bulwark, still secure

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: And confident from foreign purposes,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Even till that utmost corner of the west

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Salute thee for her king: till then, fair boy,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Will I not think of home, but follow arms.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, take his mother's thanks, a widow's thanks,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Till your strong hand shall help to give him strength

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To make a more requital to your love!

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: The peace of heaven is theirs that lift their swords

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: In such a just and charitable war.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Well then, to work: our cannon shall be bent

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Against the brows of this resisting town.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Call for our chiefest men of discipline,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To cull the plots of best advantages:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: We'll lay before this town our royal bones,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Wade to the market-place in Frenchmen's blood,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: But we will make it subject to this boy.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Stay for an answer to your embassy,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Lest unadvised you stain your swords with blood:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My Lord Chatillon may from England bring,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That right in peace which here we urge in war,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And then we shall repent each drop of blood

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That hot rash haste so indirectly shed.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Enter CHATILLON

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: A wonder, lady! lo, upon thy wish,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Our messenger Chatillon is arrived!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: What England says, say briefly, gentle lord;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: We coldly pause for thee; Chatillon, speak.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Then turn your forces from this paltry siege

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: And stir them up against a mightier task.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: England, impatient of your just demands,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Hath put himself in arms: the adverse winds,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Whose leisure I have stay'd, have given him time

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To land his legions all as soon as I;

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: His marches are expedient to this town,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: His forces strong, his soldiers confident.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: With him along is come the mother-queen,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: An Ate, stirring him to blood and strife;

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: With her her niece, the Lady Blanch of Spain;

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: With them a bastard of the king's deceased,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: And all the unsettled humours of the land,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Rash, inconsiderate, fiery voluntaries,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: With ladies' faces and fierce dragons' spleens,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Have sold their fortunes at their native homes,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Bearing their birthrights proudly on their backs,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To make hazard of new fortunes here:

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: In brief, a braver choice of dauntless spirits

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Than now the English bottoms have waft o'er

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Did nearer float upon the swelling tide,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To do offence and scath in Christendom.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Drum beats

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The interruption of their churlish drums

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Cuts off more circumstance: they are at hand,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To parley or to fight; therefore prepare.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: How much unlook'd for is this expedition!

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: By how much unexpected, by so much

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: We must awake endavour for defence;

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: For courage mounteth with occasion:

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Let them be welcome then: we are prepared.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Enter KING JOHN, QUEEN ELINOR, BLANCH, the BASTARD, Lords, and forces

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Peace be to France, if France in peace permit

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our just and lineal entrance to our own;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: If not, bleed France, and peace ascend to heaven,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Whiles we, God's wrathful agent, do correct

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Their proud contempt that beats His peace to heaven.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Peace be to England, if that war return

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: From France to England, there to live in peace.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: England we love; and for that England's sake

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: With burden of our armour here we sweat.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: This toil of ours should be a work of thine;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: But thou from loving England art so far,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: That thou hast under-wrought his lawful king

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Cut off the sequence of posterity,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Out-faced infant state and done a rape

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Upon the maiden virtue of the crown.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Look here upon thy brother Geffrey's face;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: These eyes, these brows, were moulded out of his:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: This little abstract doth contain that large

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Which died in Geffrey, and the hand of time

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Shall draw this brief into as huge a volume.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: That Geffrey was thy elder brother born,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And this his son; England was Geffrey's right

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And this is Geffrey's: in the name of God

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: How comes it then that thou art call'd a king,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: When living blood doth in these temples beat,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Which owe the crown that thou o'ermasterest?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: From whom hast thou this great commission, France,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To draw my answer from thy articles?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: From that supernal judge, that stirs good thoughts

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In any breast of strong authority,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To look into the blots and stains of right:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: That judge hath made me guardian to this boy:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Under whose warrant I impeach thy wrong

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And by whose help I mean to chastise it.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Alack, thou dost usurp authority.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Excuse; it is to beat usurping down.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Who is it thou dost call usurper, France?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Let me make answer; thy usurping son.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Out, insolent! thy bastard shall be king,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: That thou mayst be a queen, and cheque the world!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My bed was ever to thy son as true

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: As thine was to thy husband; and this boy

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Liker in feature to his father Geffrey

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Than thou and John in manners; being as like

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: As rain to water, or devil to his dam.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My boy a bastard! By my soul, I think

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: His father never was so true begot:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: It cannot be, an if thou wert his mother.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: There's a good mother, boy, that blots thy father.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: There's a good grandam, boy, that would blot thee.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Peace!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hear the crier.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: What the devil art thou?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: One that will play the devil, sir, with you,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: An a' may catch your hide and you alone:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: You are the hare of whom the proverb goes,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Whose valour plucks dead lions by the beard;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I'll smoke your skin-coat, an I catch you right;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sirrah, look to't; i' faith, I will, i' faith.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: O, well did he become that lion's robe

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: That did disrobe the lion of that robe!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: It lies as sightly on the back of him

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As great Alcides' shows upon an ass:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But, ass, I'll take that burthen from your back,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Or lay on that shall make your shoulders crack.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: What craker is this same that deafs our ears

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: With this abundance of superfluous breath?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Lewis, determine what we shall do straight.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Women and fools, break off your conference.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: King John, this is the very sum of all;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: England and Ireland, Anjou, Touraine, Maine,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: In right of Arthur do I claim of thee:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Wilt thou resign them and lay down thy arms?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My life as soon: I do defy thee, France.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Arthur of Bretagne, yield thee to my hand;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And out of my dear love I'll give thee more

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Than e'er the coward hand of France can win:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Submit thee, boy.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Come to thy grandam, child.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Do, child, go to it grandam, child:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Give grandam kingdom, and it grandam will

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Give it a plum, a cherry, and a fig:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: There's a good grandam.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Good my mother, peace!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I would that I were low laid in my grave:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I am not worth this coil that's made for me.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: His mother shames him so, poor boy, he weeps.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Now shame upon you, whether she does or no!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: His grandam's wrongs, and not his mother's shames,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Draws those heaven-moving pearls from his poor eyes,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Which heaven shall take in nature of a fee;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Ay, with these crystal beads heaven shall be bribed

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To do him justice and revenge on you.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Thou monstrous slanderer of heaven and earth!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou monstrous injurer of heaven and earth!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Call not me slanderer; thou and thine usurp

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: The dominations, royalties and rights

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Of this oppressed boy: this is thy eld'st son's son,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Infortunate in nothing but in thee:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thy sins are visited in this poor child;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: The canon of the law is laid on him,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Being but the second generation

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Removed from thy sin-conceiving womb.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Bedlam, have done.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I have but this to say,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That he is not only plagued for her sin,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But God hath made her sin and her the plague

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: On this removed issue, plague for her

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And with her plague; her sin his injury,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Her injury the beadle to her sin,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: All punish'd in the person of this child,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And all for her; a plague upon her!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Thou unadvised scold, I can produce

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: A will that bars the title of thy son.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Ay, who doubts that? a will! a wicked will:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: A woman's will; a canker'd grandam's will!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Peace, lady! pause, or be more temperate:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: It ill beseems this presence to cry aim

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To these ill-tuned repetitions.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Some trumpet summon hither to the walls

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: These men of Angiers: let us hear them speak

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Whose title they admit, Arthur's or John's.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Trumpet sounds. Enter certain Citizens upon the walls

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Who is it that hath warn'd us to the walls?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: 'Tis France, for England.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: England, for itself.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: You men of Angiers, and my loving subjects--

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: You loving men of Angiers, Arthur's subjects,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Our trumpet call'd you to this gentle parle--

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For our advantage; therefore hear us first.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: These flags of France, that are advanced here

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Before the eye and prospect of your town,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Have hither march'd to your endamagement:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The cannons have their bowels full of wrath,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And ready mounted are they to spit forth

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Their iron indignation 'gainst your walls:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: All preparation for a bloody siege

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: All merciless proceeding by these French

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Confronts your city's eyes, your winking gates;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And but for our approach those sleeping stones,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That as a waist doth girdle you about,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: By the compulsion of their ordinance

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: By this time from their fixed beds of lime

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Had been dishabited, and wide havoc made

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For bloody power to rush upon your peace.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But on the sight of us your lawful king,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Who painfully with much expedient march

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Have brought a countercheque before your gates,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To save unscratch'd your city's threatened cheeks,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Behold, the French amazed vouchsafe a parle;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And now, instead of bullets wrapp'd in fire,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To make a shaking fever in your walls,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: They shoot but calm words folded up in smoke,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To make a faithless error in your ears:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Which trust accordingly, kind citizens,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And let us in, your king, whose labour'd spirits,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Forwearied in this action of swift speed,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Crave harbourage within your city walls.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: When I have said, make answer to us both.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Lo, in this right hand, whose protection

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Is most divinely vow'd upon the right

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Of him it holds, stands young Plantagenet,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Son to the elder brother of this man,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And king o'er him and all that he enjoys:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: For this down-trodden equity, we tread

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In warlike march these greens before your town,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Being no further enemy to you

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Than the constraint of hospitable zeal

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In the relief of this oppressed child

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Religiously provokes. Be pleased then

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To pay that duty which you truly owe

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To that owes it, namely this young prince:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And then our arms, like to a muzzled bear,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Save in aspect, hath all offence seal'd up;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Our cannons' malice vainly shall be spent

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Against the invulnerable clouds of heaven;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And with a blessed and unvex'd retire,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: With unhack'd swords and helmets all unbruised,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: We will bear home that lusty blood again

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Which here we came to spout against your town,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And leave your children, wives and you in peace.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: But if you fondly pass our proffer'd offer,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: 'Tis not the roundure of your old-faced walls

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Can hide you from our messengers of war,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Though all these English and their discipline

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Were harbour'd in their rude circumference.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Then tell us, shall your city call us lord,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In that behalf which we have challenged it?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Or shall we give the signal to our rage

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And stalk in blood to our possession?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: In brief, we are the king of England's subjects:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: For him, and in his right, we hold this town.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Acknowledge then the king, and let me in.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: That can we not; but he that proves the king,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: To him will we prove loyal: till that time

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Have we ramm'd up our gates against the world.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Doth not the crown of England prove the king?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And if not that, I bring you witnesses,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Twice fifteen thousand hearts of England's breed,--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Bastards, and else.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To verify our title with their lives.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: As many and as well-born bloods as those,--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Some bastards too.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Stand in his face to contradict his claim.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Till you compound whose right is worthiest,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: We for the worthiest hold the right from both.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Then God forgive the sin of all those souls

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That to their everlasting residence,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Before the dew of evening fall, shall fleet,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In dreadful trial of our kingdom's king!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Amen, amen! Mount, chevaliers! to arms!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Saint George, that swinged the dragon, and e'er since

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sits on his horseback at mine hostess' door,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Teach us some fence!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To AUSTRIA

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sirrah, were I at home,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: At your den, sirrah, with your lioness

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I would set an ox-head to your lion's hide,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And make a monster of you.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Peace! no more.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O tremble, for you hear the lion roar.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Up higher to the plain; where we'll set forth

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In best appointment all our regiments.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Speed then, to take advantage of the field.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: It shall be so; and at the other hill

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Command the rest to stand. God and our right!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Here after excursions, enter the Herald of France, with trumpets, to the gates

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: You men of Angiers, open wide your gates,

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: And let young Arthur, Duke of Bretagne, in,

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Who by the hand of France this day hath made

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Much work for tears in many an English mother,

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Whose sons lie scattered on the bleeding ground;

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Many a widow's husband grovelling lies,

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Coldly embracing the discolour'd earth;

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: And victory, with little loss, doth play

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Upon the dancing banners of the French,

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Who are at hand, triumphantly display'd,

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: To enter conquerors and to proclaim

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Arthur of Bretagne England's king and yours.

speaker: French Herald
text_entry: Enter English Herald, with trumpet

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Rejoice, you men of Angiers, ring your bells:

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: King John, your king and England's doth approach,

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Commander of this hot malicious day:

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Their armours, that march'd hence so silver-bright,

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Hither return all gilt with Frenchmen's blood;

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: There stuck no plume in any English crest

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: That is removed by a staff of France;

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Our colours do return in those same hands

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: That did display them when we first march'd forth;

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: And, like a troop of jolly huntsmen, come

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Our lusty English, all with purpled hands,

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Dyed in the dying slaughter of their foes:

speaker: English Herald
text_entry: Open your gates and gives the victors way.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Heralds, from off our towers we might behold,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: From first to last, the onset and retire

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Of both your armies; whose equality

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: By our best eyes cannot be censured:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Blood hath bought blood and blows have answered blows;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Strength match'd with strength, and power confronted power:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Both are alike; and both alike we like.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: One must prove greatest: while they weigh so even,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: We hold our town for neither, yet for both.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Re-enter KING JOHN and KING PHILIP, with their powers, severally

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: France, hast thou yet more blood to cast away?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Say, shall the current of our right run on?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Whose passage, vex'd with thy impediment,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Shall leave his native channel and o'erswell

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: With course disturb'd even thy confining shores,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Unless thou let his silver water keep

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A peaceful progress to the ocean.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: England, thou hast not saved one drop of blood,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In this hot trial, more than we of France;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Rather, lost more. And by this hand I swear,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: That sways the earth this climate overlooks,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Before we will lay down our just-borne arms,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: We'll put thee down, 'gainst whom these arms we bear,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Or add a royal number to the dead,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Gracing the scroll that tells of this war's loss

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: With slaughter coupled to the name of kings.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Ha, majesty! how high thy glory towers,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When the rich blood of kings is set on fire!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O, now doth Death line his dead chaps with steel;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The swords of soldiers are his teeth, his fangs;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And now he feasts, mousing the flesh of men,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: In undetermined differences of kings.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Why stand these royal fronts amazed thus?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Cry, 'havoc!' kings; back to the stained field,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: You equal potents, fiery kindled spirits!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Then let confusion of one part confirm

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The other's peace: till then, blows, blood and death!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Whose party do the townsmen yet admit?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Speak, citizens, for England; who's your king?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The king of England; when we know the king.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Know him in us, that here hold up his right.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In us, that are our own great deputy

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And bear possession of our person here,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Lord of our presence, Angiers, and of you.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: A greater power then we denies all this;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: And till it be undoubted, we do lock

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Our former scruple in our strong-barr'd gates;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: King'd of our fears, until our fears, resolved,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Be by some certain king purged and deposed.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: By heaven, these scroyles of Angiers flout you, kings,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And stand securely on their battlements,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As in a theatre, whence they gape and point

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: At your industrious scenes and acts of death.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your royal presences be ruled by me:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Do like the mutines of Jerusalem,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Be friends awhile and both conjointly bend

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your sharpest deeds of malice on this town:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: By east and west let France and England mount

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Their battering cannon charged to the mouths,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Till their soul-fearing clamours have brawl'd down

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The flinty ribs of this contemptuous city:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I'ld play incessantly upon these jades,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Even till unfenced desolation

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Leave them as naked as the vulgar air.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That done, dissever your united strengths,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And part your mingled colours once again;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Turn face to face and bloody point to point;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Then, in a moment, Fortune shall cull forth

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Out of one side her happy minion,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To whom in favour she shall give the day,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And kiss him with a glorious victory.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: How like you this wild counsel, mighty states?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Smacks it not something of the policy?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Now, by the sky that hangs above our heads,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I like it well. France, shall we knit our powers

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And lay this Angiers even to the ground;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Then after fight who shall be king of it?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: An if thou hast the mettle of a king,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Being wronged as we are by this peevish town,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Turn thou the mouth of thy artillery,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As we will ours, against these saucy walls;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And when that we have dash'd them to the ground,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Why then defy each other and pell-mell

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Make work upon ourselves, for heaven or hell.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Let it be so. Say, where will you assault?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: We from the west will send destruction

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Into this city's bosom.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: I from the north.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Our thunder from the south

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Shall rain their drift of bullets on this town.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O prudent discipline! From north to south:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Austria and France shoot in each other's mouth:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I'll stir them to it. Come, away, away!

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Hear us, great kings: vouchsafe awhile to stay,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: And I shall show you peace and fair-faced league;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Win you this city without stroke or wound;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Rescue those breathing lives to die in beds,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: That here come sacrifices for the field:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Persever not, but hear me, mighty kings.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Speak on with favour; we are bent to hear.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: That daughter there of Spain, the Lady Blanch,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Is niece to England: look upon the years

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Of Lewis the Dauphin and that lovely maid:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: If lusty love should go in quest of beauty,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Where should he find it fairer than in Blanch?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: If zealous love should go in search of virtue,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Where should he find it purer than in Blanch?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: If love ambitious sought a match of birth,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Whose veins bound richer blood than Lady Blanch?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Such as she is, in beauty, virtue, birth,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Is the young Dauphin every way complete:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: If not complete of, say he is not she;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: And she again wants nothing, to name want,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: If want it be not that she is not he:

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: He is the half part of a blessed man,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Left to be finished by such as she;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: And she a fair divided excellence,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Whose fulness of perfection lies in him.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: O, two such silver currents, when they join,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Do glorify the banks that bound them in;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: And two such shores to two such streams made one,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Two such controlling bounds shall you be, kings,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: To these two princes, if you marry them.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: This union shall do more than battery can

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: To our fast-closed gates; for at this match,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: With swifter spleen than powder can enforce,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The mouth of passage shall we fling wide ope,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: And give you entrance: but without this match,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The sea enraged is not half so deaf,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Lions more confident, mountains and rocks

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: More free from motion, no, not Death himself

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: In moral fury half so peremptory,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: As we to keep this city.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Here's a stay

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That shakes the rotten carcass of old Death

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Out of his rags! Here's a large mouth, indeed,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That spits forth death and mountains, rocks and seas,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Talks as familiarly of roaring lions

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As maids of thirteen do of puppy-dogs!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What cannoneer begot this lusty blood?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He speaks plain cannon fire, and smoke and bounce;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He gives the bastinado with his tongue:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Our ears are cudgell'd; not a word of his

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But buffets better than a fist of France:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Zounds! I was never so bethump'd with words

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Since I first call'd my brother's father dad.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Son, list to this conjunction, make this match;

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Give with our niece a dowry large enough:

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: For by this knot thou shalt so surely tie

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Thy now unsured assurance to the crown,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: That yon green boy shall have no sun to ripe

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: The bloom that promiseth a mighty fruit.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I see a yielding in the looks of France;

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Mark, how they whisper: urge them while their souls

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Are capable of this ambition,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Lest zeal, now melted by the windy breath

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Of soft petitions, pity and remorse,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Cool and congeal again to what it was.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Why answer not the double majesties

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: This friendly treaty of our threaten'd town?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Speak England first, that hath been forward first

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To speak unto this city: what say you?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: If that the Dauphin there, thy princely son,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Can in this book of beauty read 'I love,'

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Her dowry shall weigh equal with a queen:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For Anjou and fair Touraine, Maine, Poictiers,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And all that we upon this side the sea,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Except this city now by us besieged,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Find liable to our crown and dignity,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Shall gild her bridal bed and make her rich

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In titles, honours and promotions,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: As she in beauty, education, blood,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Holds hand with any princess of the world.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: What say'st thou, boy? look in the lady's face.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: I do, my lord; and in her eye I find

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: A wonder, or a wondrous miracle,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: The shadow of myself form'd in her eye:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Which being but the shadow of your son,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Becomes a sun and makes your son a shadow:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: I do protest I never loved myself

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Till now infixed I beheld myself

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Drawn in the flattering table of her eye.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Whispers with BLANCH

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Drawn in the flattering table of her eye!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hang'd in the frowning wrinkle of her brow!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And quarter'd in her heart! he doth espy

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Himself love's traitor: this is pity now,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That hang'd and drawn and quartered, there should be

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: In such a love so vile a lout as he.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: My uncle's will in this respect is mine:

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: If he see aught in you that makes him like,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: That any thing he sees, which moves his liking,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: I can with ease translate it to my will;

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Or if you will, to speak more properly,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: I will enforce it easily to my love.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Further I will not flatter you, my lord,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: That all I see in you is worthy love,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Than this; that nothing do I see in you,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Though churlish thoughts themselves should be your judge,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: That I can find should merit any hate.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What say these young ones? What say you my niece?

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: That she is bound in honour still to do

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: What you in wisdom still vouchsafe to say.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Speak then, prince Dauphin; can you love this lady?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Nay, ask me if I can refrain from love;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: For I do love her most unfeignedly.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Then do I give Volquessen, Touraine, Maine,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Poictiers and Anjou, these five provinces,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: With her to thee; and this addition more,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Full thirty thousand marks of English coin.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Philip of France, if thou be pleased withal,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Command thy son and daughter to join hands.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: It likes us well; young princes, close your hands.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: And your lips too; for I am well assured

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: That I did so when I was first assured.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Now, citizens of Angiers, ope your gates,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Let in that amity which you have made;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: For at Saint Mary's chapel presently

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: The rites of marriage shall be solemnized.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Is not the Lady Constance in this troop?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: I know she is not, for this match made up

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Her presence would have interrupted much:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Where is she and her son? tell me, who knows.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: She is sad and passionate at your highness' tent.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And, by my faith, this league that we have made

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Will give her sadness very little cure.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Brother of England, how may we content

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: This widow lady? In her right we came;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Which we, God knows, have turn'd another way,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To our own vantage.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: We will heal up all;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For we'll create young Arthur Duke of Bretagne

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And Earl of Richmond; and this rich fair town

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: We make him lord of. Call the Lady Constance;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Some speedy messenger bid her repair

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To our solemnity: I trust we shall,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: If not fill up the measure of her will,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Yet in some measure satisfy her so

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That we shall stop her exclamation.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Go we, as well as haste will suffer us,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To this unlook'd for, unprepared pomp.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt all but the BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Mad world! mad kings! mad composition!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: John, to stop Arthur's title in the whole,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hath willingly departed with a part,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And France, whose armour conscience buckled on,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Whom zeal and charity brought to the field

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As God's own soldier, rounded in the ear

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: With that same purpose-changer, that sly devil,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That broker, that still breaks the pate of faith,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That daily break-vow, he that wins of all,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of kings, of beggars, old men, young men, maids,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who, having no external thing to lose

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But the word 'maid,' cheats the poor maid of that,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That smooth-faced gentleman, tickling Commodity,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Commodity, the bias of the world,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The world, who of itself is peised well,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Made to run even upon even ground,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Till this advantage, this vile-drawing bias,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This sway of motion, this Commodity,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Makes it take head from all indifferency,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: From all direction, purpose, course, intent:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And this same bias, this Commodity,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This bawd, this broker, this all-changing word,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Clapp'd on the outward eye of fickle France,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hath drawn him from his own determined aid,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: From a resolved and honourable war,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To a most base and vile-concluded peace.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And why rail I on this Commodity?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But for because he hath not woo'd me yet:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Not that I have the power to clutch my hand,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When his fair angels would salute my palm;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But for my hand, as unattempted yet,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Like a poor beggar, raileth on the rich.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Well, whiles I am a beggar, I will rail

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And say there is no sin but to be rich;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And being rich, my virtue then shall be

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To say there is no vice but beggary.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Since kings break faith upon commodity,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Gain, be my lord, for I will worship thee.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exit
